document.docTitle: Physocyclus palmarus Jiménez & Palacios-Cardiel 2013, new species
document.masterDocTitle: A new species of Physocyclus (Araneae: Pholcidae) from Mexico

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A new species of Physocyclus (Araneae: Pholcidae) from Mexico

figureCitation.captionText-0: FIGURES 1–3. 1. Distribution of Physocyclus palmarus, sp. nov.; 2. Typical habitat of the spider Physocyclus palmarus, sp. nov.; 3. Physocyclus palmarus sp. nov. female with egg sac on a palm leave.
figureCitation.captionText-1: FIGURES 4–13. 4–8. Male Physocyclus palmarus sp. nov. 4, Habitus. 5, Chelicerae, frontal view. 6, Chelicerae retrolateral view. 7, Left pedipalp, retrolateral view. 8, Left pedipalp dorsal view. LA (lateral apophysis of chelicerae). SO (stridulatory organ). DA (dorsal apophysis of procursus). VN (ventral notch of procursus). EE (embolic sclerites). E (embolus). SO (spermatic operculum). Scale bars: 2 mm (Fig. 4), 0.2 mm (Figs. 5-6), 0.5 mm (Figs. 7–8). 9–13. Female Physocyclus palmarus sp. nov. 9, Habitus, 10, Epigynum, ventral view. 11, Epigynum, retrolateral view. 12, Epigynum, anterior view showing lateral apophyses. 13, Epigynum, dorsal view, VA (ventral apophyses). PP (porous plates). Scale bars: 2 mm (Fig. 9), 0.5 mm (Figs. 10–13).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type . Male (
Holotype
):
MEXICO :
Baja California Sur
, Municipality of La Paz , San Pedro Oasis , hand collected, 23°23′22.4″N , 110°12′30.2″W ,
6 m
.
4.III.2013
, C. Palacios and M. L. Jiménez ( CARCIB 013 ), deposited at CARCIB
.
Etymology. The specific name is a noun in apposition and refers to the palm where the type was collected.

Diagnosis.
Physocyclus palmarus
appears to be closely related to
P. michoacanus Valdez-Mondragón
and
P. dugesi Simon
, but can be distinguished by the following features. Males are diagnosed by having the lateral apophysis of the chelicerae (LA) long, lightly curved and directed forward, with sclerotised cones in the basal half of the frontal lamina. The pedipalps have the embolic sclerites (EE) rounded and the embolus (E) is very wide and long and almost rounded in dorsal view and across the base of the femur, ending in a tip. Epigynum of females with ventral apophyses (VA) long, thin and directed forward.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 1–3. 1. Distribution of
Physocyclus palmarus
,
sp. nov.
; 2. Typical habitat of the spider
Physocyclus palmarus
,
sp. nov.
; 3.
Physocyclus palmarus
sp. nov.
female with egg sac on a palm leave.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Female ( paratype from the type locality
) (CARCIB 086): Coloration: Similar to male but with some differences ( Figs. 3 , 9 ). Clypeus with a complete dark band. Chelicerae ochre-dark yellow and with scattered setae. In some specimens, chelicerae are lighter; sternum grey but with some white spots in front of each coxae. Measurements: Total length 4.87, prosoma length 2.0, width 2.12. Clypeus length 1.15. Eye diameter: AME 0.13, ALE 0.23, PME 0.19, PLE 0.23, AME-PME 0.13, PME-PME 0.19. Legs length: I—femur 9.0/patela 1.0/tibia 9.75/metatarsus14.37/tarsus 2.25/total 36.37; II—7.25/0.87/7.5/11.12/1.62/28.36; III-5.25/0.75/5.62/8.37/1.37/21.36; IV-7.87/0.87/7.5/11.62/1.37/29.16. Leg formula: 1-2-4-3.
Epigynum
. Ventral apophyses (VA) wide at the base but long, thin and directed forward ending in a tip ( Figs. 10, 11, 13 ), porous plates (PP) pear-form with the anterior edge convergent and basal edge more sclerotized, with a sclerotized wide arch with ends bent sideways, the middle part of the arch with a triangle-shaped protrusion ( Fig. 12 ).

caption.paragraph:

Physocyclus palmarus
sp. nov.
4, Habitus . 5, Chelicerae, frontal view. 6, Chelicerae retrolateral view. 7, Left pedipalp, retrolateral view. 8, Left pedipalp dorsal view. LA ( lateral apophysis of chelicerae). Scale bars: 2 mm (Fig. 4), 0.2 mm (Figs. 5-6), 0.5 mm (Figs. 7–8). 9–13. Female
Physocyclus palmarus
sp. nov.
9, Habitus , 10, Epigynum , ventral view. 11, Epigynum , retrolateral view. 12, Epigynum , anterior view showing lateral apophyses. 13, Epigynum , dorsal view, VA ( ventral apophyses). PP (porous plates). Scale bars: 2 mm (Fig. 9), 0.5 mm (Figs. 10–13).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Additional material examined .
Paratypes
: MEXICO :
Baja California Sur
, Municipality of La Paz , same locality as holotype
,
2♂ ,
18.I.2013
( CARCIB 070-071 )
;
3♂ , 9♀ ,
4.III.2013
( CARCIB 072-083 ) by hand collecting, C. Palacios and M. L. Jiménez
.

Habitat. The oasis is a pond, fed by a spring and separated from the sea by a broad beach and sand dunes ( Fig. 2 ; Llinas & Jiménez 2004 ). Further inland is a grove of Washingtonian palms
Washingtonia robusta
and date palms
Phoenix dactylifera
( Fig. 1 ). Specimens were captured on the dry leaves of
W. robusta
from a height of 30 cm to 2 m in the wet area of the oasis. Males, females, females with sacs ( Fig. 3 ), and 27 juveniles were captured. Specimens also were collected from dry palm leaves, where females wove their webs.
Distribution. Known only from the type locality.
